<p>Be sure to check out all of our NFL preseason <a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/nfl/nfl-expert-picks">expert picks</a>.&nbsp;</p>

<h2>Commanders vs Patriots Picks - Preseason Week 1</h2>

<p>Washington and New England met for a few heated joint practices this week. With Vrabel even jumping in to fracas and leaving bloodied.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Commanders head coach Dan Quinn announced Jayden Daniels won't play on Friday, and with Marcus Mariota injured, journeyman Josh Johnson and rookie Sam Hartman will lead the way.&nbsp;</p>

<p>On the flip side, Vrabel proudly stated all healthy players will suit up, meaning Maye will see his first action of the season. New England likely wants their young quarterback to get some in-game reps with his new receivers, so expect them to suit up for at least a couple series.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Going back to 1996, the Patriots are 5-1 SU and ATS at home against the Commanders, with the OVER going 4-2 in those contests. On top of that, the Pats are 7-3 SU in their last 10 preseason games.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Additionally, taking a look at our <a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/nfl/nfl-coaches-preseason-betting-trends">preseason betting report</a>, Quinn is one of the worst head coaches to back in August. He's just 7-16-1 across his two head coaching stints. Don't expect very much out of the veteran-laden Commanders roster in early August. Back the Pats to cover at home.</p>

<p><strong>Commanders vs Patriots Week 1 Pick:&nbsp;</strong>Patriots -6.5 (-110)</p>

<h2>2026 NBA Most Improved Player Betting Favorite: Deni Avdija, Portland Trail Blazers</h2>

<p>Avdija's first season in Rip City was far and away the most efficient of his young career, averaging highs in points (16.9), rebounds (7.3), assists (3.9), and steals (1.0). He ended up finishing eighth in voting for Most Improved Player this past season with a single first-place vote as a result, and is on pace for bigger and better production in 2025-26 with the recent departures of both Anfernee Simons and Deandre Ayton.&nbsp;</p>

<p>He'll be entering his sixth season as a professional in the Association, and it's not unheard of for a player to receive this honor at that point in their career. Lauri Markkanen did so with the Utah Jazz in 2023, as did Victor Oladipo while with the Oklahoma City Thunder in 2018.&nbsp;</p>

<h2>2026 NBA Most Improved Player Contender: Andrew Nembhard, Indiana Pacers</h2>

<p>The Indiana Pacers' front office has confirmed that Tyrese Haliburton will miss all of next season after suffering a torn Achilles in Game 7 of the NBA Finals against the Oklahoma City Thunder. That's 18.6 points and 9.2 assists which need to be accounted for by the remaining core players, and oddsmakers believe Andrew Nembhard is the likeliest candidate to step up in Haliburton's absence, although backup Bennedict Mathurin isn't far behind on the leaderboard as of writing.</p>

<p>Nembhard produced 12.5 points while converting 46.5 percent from 3-point range during Indiana's postseason run to the Finals, both of which were noticeable improvements over what he registered during the regular season. His defense remained superb against Oklahoma City's elite guards, as well, and now with Haliburton out of the picture, the 25-year-old Canadian will have more of a spotlight to showcase his offensive chops.</p>

<h2>NBA Teams With Zero Most Improved Player Winners</h2>

<p>The following teams have never had an NBA Most Improved Player winner: Brooklyn Nets, Los Angeles Lakers, Boston Celtics, Dallas Mavericks, Charlotte Hornets, Cleveland Cavaliers, Detroit Pistons, and Sacramento Kings.</p>

<h2>How To Read NBA Most Improved Player Odds</h2>

<p>When you visit your NBA betting site of choice, you’ll notice 2025-26 NBA Most Improved Player odds laid out like this:</p>

<figure>
<figure class="figure-list"><ul class="list list__standard-list">
	<li class="list__item">Deni Avdija (+1000)</li>
</ul></figure>
</figure>

<p>It's like a&nbsp;<a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/sports-betting/betting-money-line">moneyline bet </a>where favorites are shown by the minus sign (-) and underdogs have a plus sign (+). In this scenario, Deni Avdija is favored despite being at plus money. If you were to bet $100 on Kuminga in the NBA Most Improved Player betting odds and it hits, you would win $1100 – your $100 is returned and you would get $1000 in profit.</p>

<p>If you were to bet on which player will be named Most Improved Player, you would make a futures bet.</p>

<h2>What Is A Futures Bet?</h2>

<p>This is a bet made on events that will happen in time. In this case, it’s Most Improved Player. To make a <a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/sports-betting/future-betting-lines">futures bet</a>, you would first use the handicapping info on this page to make your decision. Our <a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/tools/odds-calculator">Odds Calculator </a>can give you an idea of how much you’d win based on the Most Improved Player odds and the amount of money you bet.</p>

  <title>Murphy vs Pico Odds & Picks: Co-Main At UFC 319</title>
  <link>https://www.oddsshark.com/ufc/ufc-319-murphy-vs-pico-odds-picks-2025</link>
  <description>

<div class="field field--name-title field--type-string field--label-hidden">    <h1 class="title page-title">Murphy vs Pico Odds &amp; Picks: Co-Main At UFC 319</h1></div>


<span class="field field--name-uid field--type-entity-reference field--label-hidden news__author">
      <a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/author/ethan-diamandas" title="View user profile.">Ethan Diamandas</a>
  </span>


<span class="field field--name-created field--type-created field--label-hidden"><time datetime="2025-08-06T13:49:40-04:00" title="Wednesday, August 6, 2025 - 13:49" class="datetime">Wed, 08/06/2025 - 13:49</time>
</span>

<div class="field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden">
      <p>Aaron Pico is a -150 favorite at&nbsp;<a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/sites/all/links/fanduel.php">FanDuel</a> over Leron Murphy (+125 underdog) in the UFC 319 co-main event on August 16 in Chicago.</p>

<p>This matchup pits Bellator standout Pico against Murphy, an undefeated UFC featherweight known for his crisp striking and durability. Murphy’s polish and patience in the cage will be tested against Pico’s aggressive wrestling and punishing body attacks.</p>

<p>The Murphy vs Pico odds are tight, as both men bring elite skill sets but contrasting styles. Check out the best <a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/ufc/sites">UFC betting sites</a> to see where you can bet on UFC 319</p>

<p></p>

<h2>Murphy vs Pico Odds - UFC 319</h2>

<div class="table-wrapper"><table class="nr-table table--striped table">
	<caption>Murphy vs Pico&nbsp;Odds - UFC 319</caption>
	<thead>
		<tr>
			<th>Fighter</th>
			<th>Odds</th>
		</tr>
	</thead>
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td>Aaron Pico</td>
			<td>-150</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>Leron Murphy</td>
			<td>+125</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table></div>

<p class="content-text-promo-add-info alt-1">Odds as of August 6 at&nbsp;<a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/sites/all/links/fanduel.php">FanDuel</a></p>

<h2>How To Bet Pico</h2>

<p>Pico, making his UFC debut, is a wrecking ball when he gets rolling. His combination of world-class wrestling, sharp boxing, and vicious body shots can overwhelm opponents quickly. He’s also improved his pacing in recent fights, blending takedowns with clean punching combinations.</p>

<p>
<style type="text/css"><!--td {border: 1px solid #cccccc;}br {mso-data-placement:same-cell;}-->
</style>
</p>

<p>Backing Pico means believing he can dictate tempo early, drag Murphy into grappling exchanges, and land fight-changing shots. If you like Pico, betting him inside the distance is appealing. His style lends itself to finishes when he finds his rhythm.</p>

<h2>How To Bet Murphy</h2>

<p>Murphy is a composed, technically sound striker who rarely takes unnecessary risks. While his measured pace can frustrate fans, it also keeps him out of danger. He’s incredibly hard to stop, with a knack for finding clean counters as fights wear on.</p>

<p>The key for Murphy is forcing Pico into prolonged stand-up exchanges, where his defensive guard and accurate jab can shine. At +125, the moneyline has value for a fighter who’s never lost and knows how to neutralize aggression.</p>

<p>

<h2>Murphy vs Pico Betting Pick - UFC 319</h2>

<p>While Pico is the more explosive athlete, Murphy is the more proven UFC commodity. Bellator crossovers — like Patricio Pitbull earlier this year — have struggled under the UFC lights, and Murphy’s steadiness makes him a live underdog. I like the value on the Brit to edge out a disciplined win.</p>

<h3>Pick: Murphy (+125)</h3>

<h2>Best Bet To Miss Playoffs: Boston Celtics</h2>

<p>With Jayson Tatum presumably out for the entire campaign due to an Achilles injury, the Boston Celtics have resorted to cost-cutting measures in an effort to get under the second apron and out of the luxury tax, including trading key members of the 2024 championship roster in Jrue Holiday and Kristaps Porzingis. Former Finals Most Valuable Player Jaylen Brown and All-Defensive guard Derrick White remain, but what surrounds them is an obvious lack of depth, especially if veteran big man Al Horford departs in free agency, as well.</p>

<p>Boston has missed the playoffs only once since 2008, and while the Eastern Conference is relatively thin at the top of the standings, there's no guarantee its roster as currently constructed is good enough to land in the top eight, and that's saying something.&nbsp;</p>

<h2>Best bet to make playoffs: toronto raptors</h2>

<p>Changes could still be forthcoming for the Toronto Raptors, but if the front office currently devoid of a team president following the dismissal of Masai Ujiri stands pat, there would still be much to be excited about north of the border. A Summer League team full of rotational pieces such as Ja'Kobe Walter, Jamal Shead, and Jonathan Mogbo advanced to the semifinals out in Las Vegas, Brandon Ingram will be healthy to start the season following his arrival ahead of February's trade deadline, and the three-man unit of Scottie Barnes, Immanuel Quickley, and RJ Barrett are all 26 years of age or younger.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Teams ahead of them in the win-loss column like the Celtics and Indiana Pacers will be missing integral pieces, so a clean bill of health and the continued development and ascension of talent comprising the second unit will go a long way towards digging Toronto out of its "rebuild" and "retooling" to get back to the postseason for the first time since 2022.</p>

<h2>Best OVER Value: Los Angeles Clippers, 49.5 (+108)</h2>

<p>As of writing (August 6), the only team to have plus-money value for an OVER on their win total is the Los Angeles Clippers, who've spent the early portion of the offseason replenishing their roster with veteran talent in an effort to contend with the likes of the Oklahoma City Thunder and Denver Nuggets in the Western Conference. On top of James Harden re-signing on a two-year, $81.5-million contract, the front office brought aboard the likes of Brook Lopez, Bradley Beal after being bought out by the Phoenix Suns, a returning Chris Paul, and John Collins in a three-team trade with the Utah Jazz.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Los Angeles won 50 games last season despite only having Kawhi Leonard for 37 appearances, and when the former two-time Finals Most Valuable Player was available, the team went 26-11. There's no denying the depth has improved, albeit with mostly aging players, but even so, if this is the Clippers' all-in bid to get to the Finals, then it looks strong on paper. As long as the core group can stay off injured reserve, then at least 50 victories for a third-straight year should be in the bag.&nbsp;</p>

<h2>Best UNDER Value: Boston Celtics, 43.5 (-108)</h2>

<p>An Achilles tear to Jayson Tatum during the second round against the New York Knicks set off a chain of events which took the Boston Celtics from a legitimate threat to capture a second title in three years to one which could struggle to stay above the .500 mark. Tatum will presumably miss most of, if not all of next season, and both Kristaps Porzingis and Jrue Holiday have been shipped off to the Atlanta Hawks and Portland Trail Blazers, respectively, in cost-cutting maneuvers. With Al Horford also having one foot out the door, this leaves Jaylen Brown, Derrick White, and Sixth Man of the Year Payton Pritchard to uplift a group with new arrivals in Anfernee Simons, Georges Niang, and Luka Garza, and the upside simply isn't there.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Boston has all but waved the white flag, focusing primarily on getting out of the luxury tax and under the second apron. Even with the top of the Eastern Conference having wiggle room for teams to emerge, the Celtics now look tiers below the New York Knicks, Cleveland Cavaliers, Orlando Magic, and even the Detroit Pistons. The mighty have fallen and they've fallen hard and fast.</p>

<h2>How To Understand NBA Win Totals&nbsp;</h2>

<p>When you check out a basketball betting site, you’ll see odds for team win totals displayed like this:</p>

<figure>
<figure class="figure-list"><ul class="list list__standard-list">
	<li class="list__item">Boston Celtics O/U 58.5</li>
	<li class="list__item">OVER 58.5 +100</li>
	<li class="list__item">UNDER 58.5&nbsp;-122</li>
</ul></figure>
</figure>

<p>The number beside the team name is its projected regular-season win total. In this case, it’s 58.5 for the Boston Celtics. If you think Boston is going to win 59 or more games, you would take the OVER at +100.</p>

<p>A $100 bet would give you a payout of $200 – you get your $100 back along with your winnings of $100. Conversely, if you think they’re going to win 58 or fewer games, you’d take the UNDER at -122. That same $100 would give $181.97 – your original money returns, coupled with your prize of $81.97.</p>

<p>Our&nbsp;<a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/tools/odds-calculator">Odds Calculator</a>&nbsp;will show you what you’d get on a winning bet based on the odds and amount wagered.</p>

<h2>What Is A Prop Bet On NBA Win Totals Odds?</h2>

<p>Although this may look like a totals bet because of the OVER/UNDER aspect, this is actually a&nbsp;<a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/sports-betting/prop-betting">prop bet&nbsp;</a>because you’re technically wagering on the occurrence or non-occurrence of a specific player or team milestone. In this case, the marker is the total number of wins being more or less than the oddsmaker’s set number.</p>

<p>To&nbsp;get the best value on your&nbsp;<a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/nba/prop-bets">NBA prop bets</a>, take odds you like as soon as you see them. When oddsmakers&nbsp;set the lines, they could change as the season progresses and more games are played.</p>

<h2>NRFI Pick Today: Orioles vs Phillies (-130 at <a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/sites/all/links/fanduel.php">FanDuel</a>)</h2>

<p>Orioles vs Phillies Odds – 12:35 p.m. ET</p>

<p>We’re getting two pitchers in peak form here, making this NRFI a strong play. Trevor Rogers has been lights out since returning from a brief minors stint, sporting a perfect 9-0 NRFI record this season. Opposite him, Ranger Suarez has been just as dominant, going 15-1 NRFI with nine straight scoreless first innings.</p>

<p>With both arms rolling and no glaring matchup edge for either lineup early, -130 is excellent value for this no-run first inning.</p>

<h2>NRFI Pick Today: Guardians vs Mets (-120 at <a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/sites/all/links/draftkings.php">DraftKings</a>)</h2>

<p>Guardians vs Mets Odds – 1:10 p.m. ET</p>

<p></p>

<p>David Peterson has quietly been the Mets’ ace this year, carrying a 2.83 ERA and limiting both home runs and hard contact. He’s 18-3 NRFI and draws a Cleveland lineup that ranks below average in first-inning production. On the other side, Gavin Williams has a solid 16-6 NRFI mark and enough swing-and-miss to handle New York’s bats.</p>

<p>At -120, this is another no-run first inning worth locking in.</p>

<div class="field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden">
      <p>Highly-touted Blue Devils prospect Cooper Flagg is a member of the Dallas Mavericks after being selected first overall in the 2025 NBA draft back in June, and the expectations surrounding his inaugural campaign as a professional are immense. Sportsbooks such as&nbsp;<a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/sites/all/links/betmgm.php">BetMGM</a> have already released props for how his rookie season will unfold, from the numbers he'll average to the probability of Flagg reaching specific statistical milestones in games.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Here's a look at some of those props and whether or not the 18-year-old phenom is likely to boost units for bettors stemming from his production.&nbsp;</p>

<p>

<h2>Cooper Flagg 2025-26 Regular Season Props</h2>

<div class="table-wrapper"><table class="table table--default table--striped" border="1" cellpadding="1" cellspacing="1" style="height: 100%; width: 100%;">
	<thead>
		<tr>
			<th scope="col">Prop</th>
			<th scope="col">Odds</th>
		</tr>
	</thead>
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td>Cooper Flagg To Record A Triple-Double In Any Game</td>
			<td>-115</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>Cooper Flagg To Score 40+ Points In Any Game</td>
			<td>+325</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>Cooper Flagg To Score 50+ Points In Any Game</td>
			<td>+2000</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table></div>

<p class="content-text-promo-add-info alt-1">Odds as of August 6,&nbsp;2025&nbsp;at&nbsp;<a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/sites/all/links/betmgm.php">BetMGM</a></p>

<p>Triple-doubles for rookies don't grow on trees, evident by the fact that only two manifested in 2024-25 and neither by a player drafted in the first round. Jonathan Mogbo (31st) of the Toronto Raptors and Keaton Wallace (undrafted) of the Atlanta Hawks each registered one, but it took until the last days of the regular season to make them a reality. Victor Wembanyama had two in 2023-24, one of which included blocks, while Amen Thompson snuck in with one during the final game on the schedule.&nbsp;</p>

<p>This isn't to suggest that Flagg doesn't have the tools to pull one off himself, but the irregularity in which they occur paired with the Mavericks possessing so much veteran talent, many of which have made All-Star teams like Anthony Davis, Klay Thompson, and a recovering Kyrie Irving, makes a triple-double for Flagg more unlikely than likely. With a fully healthy depth chart, Flagg would be the third option in the starting lineup at best, perhaps even fourth on some nights, so that doesn't equate to the ball being in his hands all that often compared to his days at Duke.</p>

<p>That should also hinder his ability to drop 40 or more points in a game, something all rookies this past season failed to accomplish. Hawks forward Zaccharie Risacher did come close with 38, but from 2010 through 2024, only Wembanyama, Blake Griffin, and Anthony Edwards reached 40 points or more in their rookie year as a No. 1 pick. Scoring 50 points as a rookie is even more rare, having been accomplished only six times since 1965 and not since Brandon Jennings had 55 for the Milwaukee Bucks on November 14, 2009.&nbsp;</p>

<h2>Cooper Flagg 2025-26 Regular Season Averages</h2>

<h3>Points Per Game</h3>

<div class="table-wrapper"><table class="table table--default table--striped" border="1" cellpadding="1" cellspacing="1" style="height: 100%; width: 100%;">
	<thead>
		<tr>
			<th scope="col">Average</th>
			<th scope="col">OVER</th>
			<th scope="col">UNDER</th>
		</tr>
	</thead>
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td>16.9</td>
			<td>-115</td>
			<td>-115</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table></div>

<p class="content-text-promo-add-info alt-1">Odds as of August 6,&nbsp;2025&nbsp;at&nbsp;<a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/sites/all/links/betmgm.php">BetMGM</a></p>

<h3>Rebounds Per Game</h3>

<div class="table-wrapper"><table class="table table--default table--striped" border="1" cellpadding="1" cellspacing="1" style="height: 100%; width: 100%;">
	<thead>
		<tr>
			<th scope="col">Average</th>
			<th scope="col">OVER</th>
			<th scope="col">UNDER</th>
		</tr>
	</thead>
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td>6.1</td>
			<td>-115</td>
			<td>-115</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table></div>

<p class="content-text-promo-add-info alt-1">Odds as of August 6,&nbsp;2025&nbsp;at&nbsp;<a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/sites/all/links/betmgm.php">BetMGM</a></p>

<p>Oddsmakers currently slotting Flagg's scoring and rebounding averages at 16.9 and 6.1, respectively, is perhaps underselling his individual talent, but it's once again indicative of the talent level on Dallas and the lack of need for Flagg to put up monster numbers out of the gate.</p>

<p>Should his statistics hover around these marks, it would be the second-fewest points averaged by a No. 1 pick since 2019, beating out only Risacher from last year (12.3). Since 2000, only five non-centers (Kenyon Martin, Blake Griffin, Ben Simmons, Zion Williamson, and Paolo Banchero) picked first have averaged better than six rebounds per game, as well.&nbsp;</p>

      <p>Canelo Alvarez will defend his undisputed super middleweight titles against Terence Crawford on September 13 in Las Vegas.</p>

<p>Canelo is still a -180 favorite vs Crawford (+145 underdog) at <a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/sites/all/links/bet365.php">bet365</a>, largely because Crawford must jump two full weight classes to meet him at 168 pounds.</p>

<p>The fight will be broadcast globally on Netflix.</p>

<h2>Alvarez vs Crawford Odds</h2>

<div class="table-wrapper"><table class="table table--striped">
	<thead>
		<tr>
			<th>Fighter</th>
			<th>Odds</th>
		</tr>
	</thead>
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td>Canelo Alvarez</td>
			<td>-180</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>Terence Crawford</td>
			<td>+145</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table></div>

<p class="content-text-promo-add-info alt-1">Odds as of August 6&nbsp;at&nbsp;<a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/sites/all/links/bet365.php">bet365</a></p>

<p>Using <a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/tools/odds-calculator">our odds calculator,</a>&nbsp;Alvarez's favorite status means a $100 bet on him pays out $155.56. The same bet $100 bet on Crawford pays out $245.</p>

<h2>How To Bet Canelo</h2>

<p>While Crawford might outbox Canelo in stretches, he doesn’t have the durability or power to secure a clear victory, despite what some boxing purists believe. Canelo’s explosiveness, raw strength, and ability to exploit his power edge could lead to a knockout, especially given his track record against southpaws. With an all-time great chin and elite defensive instincts, Canelo has consistently slipped or rolled through big shots since the GGG trilogy, leaving Crawford with little to no chance of landing a fight-ending blow.</p>

<p>That defense by Canelo is so big, as is the Mexican's adaptability. Alvarez can win in so many different ways, and he should be extra confident with the power advantage on his side. Anyone who’s watched a Canelo Alvarez fight knows his mastery in the pocket, using vicious bodywork to either end the fight or lower his opponent’s guard for headshots. Add a little oomph to each shot, and I predict Canelo by KO.</p>

<h2>How to Bet Crawford</h2>

<p>There is a strong case to be made that Crawford is the P4P most skilled fighter in boxing. Crawford's win over Errol Spence Jr. showcased his exceptional skill and technical superiority, reminding everyone who the man is at welterweight. But now we're talking about a jump to super middleweight, where size and strength advantages swing in Canelo's favor.&nbsp;</p>

<p>In boxing, jumping weight classes is rarely a good idea. While "Bud" has plenty of heart and will undoubtedly showcase it in a superfight against Canelo, at 37 years old, he’s unlikely to withstand Alvarez’s power for long and could suffer a TKO after five or six rounds.</p>

<p>That said, if you like Crawford, you can bet him as the underdog or even wager him by decision for better value.</p>

<h2>Alvarez vs Crawford Pick</h2>

<p>Bet on Alvarez by KO. His power, experience at super middleweight, and ability to adapt in the ring make him the likeliest winner, especially against a smaller opponent like Crawford.</p>

<h3>Pick: Canelo Alvarez by KO (+333)</h3>

<h2>Bengals vs Eagles Picks - Preseason Week 1</h2>

<p>Cincinnati has risen to as high as six-point favorites after head coach Zac Taylor announced on Tuesday that star quarterback Joe Burrow will be among the starters for Thursday's preseason opener. Taylor went so far as stating that the starters will play "several series" against the reigning champs.&nbsp;</p>

<p>The Bengals sparkling form away from home during the preseason is likely another reason they're big favorites for this contest. After all, Cincinnati has gone 8-2 ATS in their last 10 road preseason games. However, before you go rushing to the window, be aware, the Bengals were underdogs in each of those games.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Having said that, the Eagles have been brutal in the preseason under head coach Nick Sirianni going just 3-7-2 overall and 4-7-1 ATS. In fact, Philly is just 1-8-1 SU, and 1-9 ATS at home in their past 10 contests. Diving even deep, the <a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/nfl/super-bowl/futures">Super Bowl</a> 59 champs are 0-6-1 SU and 0-7 ATS in their last seven games as a home favorite.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Taking a quick glance at the depth chart, both teams boast a plethora of intriguing backup quarterbacks. Burrow will give way to to Jake Browning and likely Desmond Ridder in this Bengals vs Eagles contest. While if Jalen Hurts suits up, the Eagles have promising backup Tanner McKee, the electric athleticism of Dorian Thompson-Robinson (who's started a handful of games for the Browns), and rookie Kyle McCord waiting in the wings. Plus, both teams have a ton of young talent at wide receiver, with players like Johnny Wilson, Terrace Marshall Jr., Charlie Jones and Jermaine Burton looking for a chance to shine. With both defenses likely to play a vanilla scheme in the first week of August, I'm on the OVER 38.5 points here. There's simply too much offensive talent on the field too ignore, especially if Burrow and the Bengals starters play multiple series against a hodge-podge version of the Eagles defense.&nbsp;</p>

<p><strong>Bengals vs Eagles Preseason Week 1 Pick:</strong> OVER 38.5 Points (-105) at&nbsp;<a href="https://www.oddsshark.com/sites/all/links/fanduel.php">FanDuel</a></p>

<h2>Dolidze vs Hernandez Betting Odds</h2>

<div class="table-wrapper"><table class="nr-table table--striped table">

<h2>How to Bet Anthony Hernandez</h2>

<p>Anthony “Fluffy” Hernandez enters UFC Vegas as a rising force in the middleweight division, riding a seven-fight win streak with his latest triumph coming over Brendan Allen. His submission game is lethal, and his cardio allows him to grind opponents down with relentless pace and ground control.</p>

<p>While Dolidze is ranked slightly higher (#8 vs Hernandez's #9) and has never been finished in the UFC, Hernandez has all the tools to dominate over five rounds. Dolidze is tough and strong, but expect Hernandez to win minutes on the mat and slowly chip away at the Georgian’s defense.</p>

<p>The best betting value is Hernandez to win + OVER 2.5 rounds at +100 — a sharp parlay for a fighter who likely wins by decision or late submission. Straight ML (-334) is parlay fodder, but this combo bet brings real value.</p>

<p>

<h3>How to Bet Roman Dolidze</h3>

<p>Dolidze is a durable, gritty middleweight with solid grappling and brute strength. You can think of him as a caveman wrestling with flashes of explosive striking. He hasn’t been finished in the UFC and has pushed through multiple grueling decisions, showing off stamina and toughness.</p>

<p>If you believe in the upset, the only angle is a straight play on Dolidze at +250. He won’t win minutes against Hernandez on the ground, but a sneaky reversal or a thudding shot could swing momentum his way. Still, his path is murky, and this is a tough stylistic draw.</p>

<h2>Dolidze vs Hernandez Pick</h2>

<p>Hernandez has all the momentum, tools, and fight IQ to control this matchup. Dolidze’s toughness should extend this fight past the midway point, but the younger, more active Hernandez should pull away late.</p>

<h2>Pick: Hernandez ML + OVER 2.5 rounds (+100)</h2>
